text: right on. Thank you!

Drag n Drop email templates - found a bug that’s making a simple task take forever.

You can’t create global groups in email templates.

I’m using all stock HS modules in the area I’m trying to group. go to convert to global module and a tooltip pops up saying ` groups containing flex columns, global groups, or non-upgraded modules cannot be made global`
<https://spin.d.pr/uYY7XS+>
is it possible to create a global group inside of a coded template?
Hey yall. Dev/Client beware: <https://www.wfla.com/8-on-your-side/better-call-behnken/web-developers-unaware-of-ada-accessibility-standards-business-owners-face-lawsuits/1766023178>

yea, definitely important.

It’s often a hard sell to clients unfortunately
Show them this next time
there is a lady who has sued 123ish companies
they are frivilous lawsuits
but they are happening
not sure if it’s still true, but I believe it was at one point, that there was a limitation to what types of businesses were required by law to comply to this.
Good resource <https://a11yproject.com/>
I think that is what this lady is testing
she doesnt want to get a job, so she sues small businesses and wins lawsuits
I can’t say I blame her, and I honestly can’t say she’s doing a bad thing. as much as it sucks that people are sue happy, we do have to be better as developers to build a11y compatibly.

I just hope if lawsuits start occuring for html emails not being a11y that email clients get the blame.
Hopefully that would cause them to adopt standards and finally start to catch up to the web

I dont disagree with the fact that there needs to be education and wide adoption. BUT these are real peoples lives we are dealing with. And almost 100% of them were completely ignorant to the fact that this was even a thing.
She could successfully put hundreds of peoples lively hoods at risk to simply prove a point
Agreed
Will DM you directly <@U98Q2GNL9>
oh I 100% agree that it really sucks for the companies especially.

because they can’t even really sue the developers(thankfully) because there’s no expectation currently that a site will be built a11y by default.

not a lawmaker or anything but I think it should be done in such a way that maybe businesses of a certain size should be required, and maybe have different required levels of a11y compatibility.

Smaller businesses should be exempt(you don’t want x startup to go under before they get a start, just because an audience that may not be relevant to them can’t use their site)

And the amount that can be sued for should be kept low, but an amount that would increase over the years to encourage better a11y support.
Are you still wondering this <@U7SL518D6>? I can do some hunting for you if you'd like

I’m not because I found a work-around to my problem, but I do think this would be interesting to know in general. I doubt it’s possible. I’d assume you’d have to create a drag n drop template to create a global group then load the group into a coded template that way.

I have two domains, one which is our main website using HubSpot CMS, and another domain which is our actual saas software product (not part of HubSpot). The new user signup process is on our non-HS domain, but we would like new users on our main website to fill out a form with just their email address and click a "Sign Up" button to be directed to our actual signup page with the email address already populated in the sign up form. With HubSpot forms, you can obviously redirect to an external page, but I don't see a way within HS to append a query string with the email address.

What would be the easiest way to accomplish passing a query string in the URL from the HubSpot site when a form is completed? Is there a way to do this in the HubSpot CMS? Or would this require building a custom module for the form that uses the Forms API and then inserting that module on the page?

HubSpot actually does support just having a query parameter in the URL to autofill forms.
<https://knowledge.HubSpot.com/articles/kcs_article/forms/can-i-auto-populate-form-fields-through-a-query-string>

hi there :wave:, we're looking at making a couple of updates to the preformatted and code options in available in the rich text and I was wondering: do you use the "Pre" option in rich text? If so, what do you use it for? Code? Something else?
Haven’t personally used the pre option but yes I would use it for code primarily

We use both Pre and Code but it is mainly because we also use Prism.js for our code formatting on our blogs. If we could use flexible columns in our blog posts, we would be able to make CM's for this instead.
we have used it for some client for "complex" CTAs. Like CTAs with background left/right IMGs, titles and a button

Thanks Jon, but that's the reverse of what I'm looking for. I need to pre-populate a field in a non-HubSpot form by passing a query string from the HubSpot form redirect. Any  simple way you know of to have the form redirect URL include a query string when a HubSpot form is submitted?

ahhh I see. unfortunately it’s not easy at all. it’s pretty complicated, don’t remember entirely everything you need to do but basically the jist of it was your submit the form through an invisible iframe and you handle the redirect yourself.
ok thanks!
Hi everyone, I'm curious if anyone has tips or best practices around creating translations of staged pages. Has anyone run into any issues or found it pretty smooth? How do you like to go about it?
Not sure where to find this but has anyone managed to set the titles for system pages such as Error 404, 500, and Search Results respectively?
I haven’t but I know how, use JS to set it.
`document.title = "New Title"`
Pretty neat trick I must say. Thanks Jon! :100:

For email sending, does anyone else get these soft bounces:
```
Rejected by recipient's email security filter

SENDING_DOMAIN_MISCONFIGURATION 550 Sender rejected
The From address domain does not authorize HubSpot to send on it's behalf, ask your IT team to check DKIM or SPF.
```

We've verified the SPF is setup correctly and also the DKIM (Email Sending Domains) is showing connected. So we are at a loss here

Hello, I new in HubSpot and was invited to this slack community.

I used HubSpot as blog. And need show last posts in wordpress. For this I used rss from HubSpot. But there in xml I not see any thumbnail for featured image, just in description. And there size of image 1000px x 1000px . Like result I have complain from gmetrix about server scaled images.

My question - it is possible define size for featured image in rss,xml in description ? Or find way have it as thumbnail
